alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 4:33PM MST until August 15 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 430 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across a large portion west of US 191 and along and south of SR 264. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keams Canyon, First Mesa, Jadito, Jeddito, Tees Toh, Seba Dalkai, Cedar Springs, White Cone, Toyei, Steamboat Canyon, Steamboat, Navajo, Polacca, Second Mesa and Shongopovi. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 377 and 427. State Route 87 between mile markers 379 and 406. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bluebird Canyon Wash, Keams Canyon Wash, Wepo Wash, Polacca Wash, Jeddito Wash, Beshbito Wash, Coyote Wash, Oraibi Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Steamboat Wash, Tees Toh Wash and Bidahochi Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
